thread.title: Sharon Jones & The Dap Kings set for Riverside
thread.title_full: Sharon Jones & The Dap Kings set for Riverside

author: Wes Woods
title: Sharon Jones & The Dap Kings set for Riverside
text:
Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival veterans Sharon Jones & The Dap Kings, who are set to perform Nov. 6 in Riverside, are also offering a music workshop for local students before the show.
Group member and Riverside-raised Gabriel Roth is joining with the Fox Riverside Theater Foundation for the free workshop, according to a foundation news release.
The workshop takes place at 3:30 p.m. Nov. 6 before the show in the Riverside Municipal Auditorium. There will also be 300 discounted tickets offered to workshop students and parents for the night show at $15.
To attend the 7 p.m. show, without going to the workshop, tickets are $25 for general admission. Opening for the Grammy Award-nominated soul and funk group is the Summer Twins.
For more information on getting students to attend, contact the Fox Riverside Theater Foundation at 951-826-5769 or cwright@riversideca.gov.
Before the Sharon Jones & The Dap Kings show at the auditorium is radio station X103.9’s blind date beerfest, featuring a mystery alternative rock band.
The event, for ages 21 and older, starts at noon Oct. 31. Tickets are $45. On the event’s Facebook page , the participating band is described as “one of the most popular alternative rock bands of all time.” A previous blind date event held in May featured a concert with The Offspring. The concert starts at 3 p.m.
Participating breweries include Dale Bros, Hangar 24, Wild Donkey Brewing Co., Aftershock Brewery, Brew Rebellion, No Clue Brew, Ritual Brewing Co., Stone Brewing Co. and many more.
The radio station’s website is www.x1039.com/ .
Punk band
And the day after the Sharon Jones & The Dap Kings show, Las Vegas post-hardcore punk band Falling In Reverse co-headlines the venue with Attila and special guest Metro Station. Opening the Nov. 7 show is Inland Empire pop punk and alternative band Assuming We Survive. Tickets for the show, which starts at 6 p.m., are $25.
The Riverside Municipal Auditorium is at 3485 Mission Inn Ave., Riverside.
For more information, head to http://venue.riversiderma.com/ or Live Nation at 866-448-7849 or www.livenation.com .
Casino performances
Moving on to the nearby casino scene, Tuan Hung, Paquita la del Barrio, Dave Koz & Friends and Ramon Ayala all have upcoming dates at the San Manuel Indian Bingo & Casino near Highland.
Starting with “Tuan Hung’s Live Show — Addictions,” the performance features headliner Hung (judge from “The Voice” in Vietnam) at 5 p.m. Nov. 8. Besides Hung, according to the casino release, there will be a musical variety show with a four-member backing band, two comedians and seven guest performers.
Advertisement
Next will be ranchera performer la del Barrio, who was born in Alto Lucero, Veracruz, Mexico and has been performing since 1970. Her performance is set to be at 7:30 p.m. Nov. 12.
Grammy Award-winning Norteño performer Ramón Ayala Y Sus Bravos Del Norte is set to bring his accordion for a 7:30 p.m. Dec. 10 date. Opening for the Ayala is his son Ramón Ayala Jr.
Lastly, Dave Koz & Friends are set for their Christmas Tour 2015 at 7:30 p.m. Dec. 17. Playing with the smooth jazz saxophonist Koz will be Candy Dulfer, Bill Medley and Jonathan Butler.
To enter the casino shows, you must be age 21 and older. The casino is at 777 San Manuel Blvd., Highland.
Tickets for the casino shows range from $35-$70 for Hung; $25-$45 for la del Barrio; $50-$70 for Ayala; and $40-$50 for Koz.
For more information, contact Ticketmaster at 866-448-7849 or head to www.ticketmaster.com
About the Author Wes covers culture and entertainment for the Inland Valley Daily Bulletin, The Sun and the Redlands Daily Facts. Reach the author at wes.woods@langnews.com or follow Wes on Twitter: @JournoWes .
